page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This 'D' block covers a rural area on the south-west escarpment of the Cotswolds. Within the area are the villages of Hillesley, Alderley and Tresham, and the hamlets of Lower Kilcott and Wortley. Alderley and Wortley are within the county of Gloucestershire. The other villages were also in that county until the government county boundary re-organisation in 1974, since when Hillesley, Tresham and Lower Kilcott have been situated within the newly formed county of Avon. Hillesley covers the largest of the residential areas within the block, and also has the greatest population. Most of the area is covered by farmland, some of which has been planted with crops, but most is rough grazing land. The woodland areas are dominantly deciduous trees.
